Windlord/Nighlight:

Nighlight wasnt decided if fight or not, she couldnt l=
eave alone Elita; Windlord moved quickly where Ravenchief location
  ----- =
Original Message ----- 
  From: Richard Allen 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com=
 
  Sent: Thursday, November 01, 2007 8:02 PM
  Subject: Re: THE MINIONS OF=
 UNICRON HAVE COME!


  ::Rodimus Prime/Kup::

  Rodimus and Kup both dive =
deep into the water to avoid the Sweeps attacks.

  They both then bob back=
 to the surface with their rifles drawn/ They each fire three shots at each=
 attacking Sweep. Hopefully they would be dealt with that easily because Ro=
dimus had a new target. If the past was coming back Rodimus wanted to take =
care of Cyclonus and Scourge.

  Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> w=
rote:


    Above the city sweeps keep up a steady pounding as they move ab=
ove and
    amidst the buildings. Like a wave of swarm their disintegration=
 beams
    blaze into the buildings below with a frightening intensity. As =
the
    defensive shields go up and the missile battery opens fire on Scour=
ge,
    like killer bees on the warpath several sweeps fly at the battery, =
the
    air seeming to almost buzz with laserfire! The defenders at the mis=
sile
    battery do manage to pull down a few sweeps, only to have a few mo=
re
    take their place and continue firing. 

    Lord Perseus and the tro=
ops have a similar effect as they lay into the
    sweeps, their blasts cut=
ting down a few sweeps. For a moment there is a
    reprieve as sweeps expl=
ode with a satisfying blaze of fire and light.
    But then more come from =
different directions. It's like firing into a
    swarm, you hit a few, and=
 a few more come. Their attacks coming from
    everywhere above them and t=
o the sides, laser blasts and disintegration
    beams rock their fortified=
 area, seeking to terminate those housed
    within!

    Without any comma=
nds from Nightstrike and Darkfate the sweeps around
    the Maximal base ju=
st continue to pound on it from above, seemingly
    content to keep anythi=
ng on the inside the base pent up there. Anything
    so foolish as to step=
 out of its doors face their cannons with a most
    grueling intensity!

 =
   In the air above Scourge is only slightly impressed as the Maximal
    (=
Ravenchief) evades his blast, hoever it is the fact that he is ignored
    =
totally that sets his nerves on edge. It is then they his proximity
    ala=
rms flip on warning him of the incoming missiles. He chuckles, "Only
    si=
x?? They don't know me!" With a blast of power he drops down to near
    st=
reet level, zipping between tall buildings, far more agile then
    simple =
missiles. As several of them hit structures rather then him his
    laugh e=
choes through the streets below. 

    Scourge's laugh slows a bit as he re=
alizes that a few missiles continue
    to follow him then. "Heat seekers."=
 He grumbles for a moment and then
    chuckles, "This should be fun!" Flyi=
ng towards one of the large
    buildings he peppers it with laser fire, se=
tting it ablaze. Then with a
    mighty thrust from his hover jets, which p=
ut out much less heat, he
    pushes to the side and around the building as=
 the building which is now
    much hotter then he receives the brunt of th=
e remaining missile
    strikes. His laugh echoes once again through the st=
reets as several
    sweeps meet him there and begin to rain destruction! 
=

    In the air somewhat closer to the shoreline, Cyclonus had continued in=

    the direction he was going, his jets flaring with power, the wind
    =
almost screaming as it moved past him! As his own missiles exploded
    spe=
ctacularly at the railing he merely flew through blaze, with all the
    at=
tendant dramatic glory, allowing the heat of the explosion to either
    at=
tract Ravenchief's missiles attention or detonate them. In either
    case =
he rose high into the air, careful to stay out of the line of fire
    from=
 those on the shoreline below, as the missles just added to the
    wreckag=
e that fell towards the waters below. 

    Shifting to his robot mode, Cyc=
lonus turned his gaze to the approaching
    Ravenchief, his form seeming t=
o almost radiate power as he floated in
    mid air. He is tall and almost =
regal, seeming to be almost made for the
    air boued as he was on powerfu=
l thrusters that took the place of his
    feet. 

    His voice is deep an=
d resonate, exactly the pitch and timber of the
    Cyclonus of old, "Is th=
is what you wanted Maximal?" Cyclonus lets go
    with two more missiles, q=
uickly the air behind them began to spin, then
    ripple and finally burst=
 aflame as they pulled away from Cyclonus and
    streaked towards Ravenchi=
ef!

    At the shoreline below Doc manages to hit one of the two sweeps
  =
  menacing him. However these sweeps are not jets and share very few of
   =
 their frailties; they are made for hunting and pursuing hostile prey,
    =
and their armor is extremely durable. The laser fire smokes along the
    s=
urface of the sweep's armor, leaving a nasty gash, but does not bring
    i=
t down. The sweeps just slow and stop just over the edge of the water
    a=
nd open up with a barrage of laser fire at Doc's position.

    Meanwhile f=
rom above several sweeps move down following Rodimus and
    kup, also open=
ing up with cannon fire at the swimming and hopefully
    helpless Maximals=
 below.

    Preston
    (Da'minion)
